Key Arguments: The legislation undermines freedom of expression, which is fundamental to democracy.
Misinformation and disinformation do not pose a threat to the safety and wellbeing of Australians or democracy.
The government is controlling the narrative by labeling opposing views as misinformation.
Media should provide a balanced view, but currently only one side of the argument is presented.
The proposed powers would allow the government to control all information available to the public.
Notable Quotes: Freedom of expression is what democracy is about, having your own ideas and thoughts, not being dictated to as to what you must believe.
The Government is not allowing any information against their narrative and agenda, this is not a democratic process.
This Bill should not be approved as it is an erosion of the democratic process that all Australians live under.
